msgSnippet: Hi all, I m testing a class that Spring creates an instance for me at runtime (and my code is using it through the interface type) therefore I never do new

Subject: Testing object instantiated by Spring
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=205922247

Hi all,

I'm testing a class that Spring creates an instance for me at runtime
(and my code is using it through the interface type) therefore I never
do "new MyClass()" in the production code. In the programmer tests,
would you use the same method of creating the concrete class or would
you call new MyClass() to keep it simple?

Thanks,

- Yagiz Erkan -
http://yagiz.blogspot.com
http://www.erkans.com
subject: Testing object instantiated by Spring
